Will the $25,000 Tesla use faster-charging CATL LFP cells? üîã‚ö°

Battery supplier CATL is developing faster-charging battery cells for Tesla, according to Bloomberg (via Automotive News).

CATL chairman Robin Zeng mentioned this project in an interview with Bloomberg in Hong Kong on Monday, in which he also confirmed that CATL is supplying equipment for Tesla's Nevada battery factory. Zeng also mentioned Tesla's ongoing effort to develop a $25,000 electric car, perhaps hinting that the new cells may go into it.

"There's always room for cost reduction depending on what the $25,000 car's aim is," Zeng said, noting that a "robotaxi" wouldn't require cost reduction at the cell level because the longer life cycle of CATL's batteries would keep average cost for that application lower.

Since its 2020 Battery Day, the company has been pushing ahead to make its own cells but hasn't backed away either from sourcing cells from other suppliers. Tesla already uses CATL LFP cells, which cost less to make in money and carbon footprint, in the Model 3 in the U.S., and in the Model Y for some other markets, and it was at one time also considering the LFP-based BYD Blade battery for its vehicles made in China.

CATL, for its part, already boasted last year that its next-generation LFP battery tech can add 250 miles of range in 10 minutes. In addition to Tesla, its customers include BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Ford, which has restarted construction on a Michigan plant making CATL LFP cells under license‚Äîand what Ford touted as a key to future EV affordability.

Biden administration policies have already set a strong policy discouraging Chinese content, although a second Trump administration might apply a different kind of action.

‚ÄºÔ∏è Tesla Semi Trucks has shipped over 20,000 battery packs out of Giga Nevada ... (plus EPA Rules coming)

The Tesla Semi has been proving itself in real-world situations, with the company‚Äôs fleet of all-electric Class 8 trucks transporting over 20,000 battery packs from Gigafactory Nevada to the Fremont Factory. 

The update was shared by Tesla Senior Manager for Semi Truck Engineering Dan Priestley, who recently provided some insights on the US Environmental Protection Agency‚Äôs (EPA) Phase 3 rules.

The EPA recently announced a final rule, ‚ÄúGreenhouse Gas Emissions Standards for Heavy-Duty Vehicles ‚Äì Phase 3.‚Äù As stated by the agency on its official website, the rule sets stronger standards to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from heavy-duty vehicles beginning in model year 2027. 

Vehicles covered by the new standards include large trucks like day cabs and sleeper units.

Dong Maimai: I heard that the world's highest-mileage Tesla has already traveled 2 million kilometers. By the time it reached 1.9 million kilometers, it had already gone through 4 batteries and 13 motors. How expensive are Tesla batteries? In China, replacing one costs about 220,000 yuan each time.

Currently, the world's longest-distance NIO has reached 570,000 kilometers, and the newest thing on this NIO is probably the battery. In terms of production technology, NIO relies on strong R&D to enhance battery life. Operationally, NIO uses various models to balance the number of battery charge and discharge cycles with power. In some cases, supercharging can significantly shorten battery life due to severe working conditions causing large temperature differences. However, the liquid cooling system at the battery swap station balances the temperature, which, in turn, increases life expectancy.

The most crucial aspect is maintenance. If a battery swap station needs to repair a battery, it can be removed from circulation on-site in a second. As for in-car battery maintenance, well, that requires a return to the factory and disassembly. In the future, batteries that are extensively glued together in various ctc and ctb configurations will not only be difficult to maintain, but even their retirement and recycling will impact efficiency.I believe that a battery-swapping system based on standardized battery packs will see more and more automakers joining and adopting it. 

Looking at the bigger picture, for consumers, buying a battery swap is like having a lifetime warranty on the battery. For companies that offer battery swapping, the cost of each battery is actually low, and they can make money throughout the entire lifecycle, making it beneficial for everyone.The consensus should be that one can buy many electric vehicles, but having one that offers battery swapping as a safety net is essential. $NIO $TSLA

Every day, the Tesla Semi demonstrates that battery electric trucks can directly replace diesel trucks. With our own fleet of Semis, Tesla has shipped >20,000 battery packs out of Gigafactory Nevada to support Fremont vehicle builds. These trucks run the same route, carrying the same load (no load reduction for weight) as the diesel trucks running this route but at substantially lower operating cost. Now, it‚Äôs about scale.

The EPA Phase 3 rules will help hasten the overall fleet transition to zero emissions and address the harmful particulate emissions and other pollutants from diesel trucks. In combination with the superior economics and experience that battery electric trucks provide, I expect full market adoption will occur faster than many think.

Elon Musk, the enigmatic CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, is known for his bold vision for the future of sustainable energy. From electric vehicles and solar power to battery storage and grid infrastructure, Musk is leading the charge in transforming the way we produce and consume energy. His ambitious goals, such as making solar power the dominant energy source on Earth and transitioning to a fully electric transport system, have sparked excitement and debate among industry experts and environmentalists alike. As Musk continues to push the boundaries of what's possible in the realm of clean energy, the world watches with anticipation to see how his vision will shape the future of our planet.

Citing internal data, Tesla China noted in a post on its official Weibo account that the battery management system (BMS) used in its vehicles ensures that batteries are able to last for a very long time. 

Tesla notes that its BMS ensures that batteries are not overcharged or overdischarged, and they also ensure that cells are safe from damage at all times.

Tesla China also noted that due to the innovations and protections it has implemented on its vehicles‚Äô batteries, its battery packs are able to last a very long time. 

A Tesla Model S, for example, has reportedly been found to lose only 12% of its battery capacity after 320,000 kilometers (200,000 miles) of driving.¬†
